title: The Allen Key Changed Assembly Forever
description: A 60-second lesson on The Allen Key Changed Assembly Forever.

hook.text: The hexagonal Allen key is the most-used tool on Earth. IKEA alone hands out over 200 million of them per year.

buildup.text: Invented in the 1910s, hex socket screws sit flush inside materialâ€”no protruding head, clean look, simple tool.

discovery.text: Flat-pack relies on cam locks and Allen bolts anyone can tighten. No drill, no skill, no experience required.

twist.text: Cam locks are weaker than traditional wood joints. But they're infinitely re-assemblableâ€”glued joints are permanent.

climax.text: Self-assembly democratized furnishing. A student can fill an apartment in one afternoon with nothing but Allen keys.

punchline.text: One tiny L-shaped tool furnished the world.

quiz.question: Why is the cam lock joint preferred in flat-pack furniture despite being weaker?
options: It can be assembled and disassembled repeatedly without glue
It costs less than other types of screws and bolts
It holds better in particleboard than traditional screws
